text: Attorneys for the United States of America

text: IN  THE  UNITED  STATES  DISTRICT  COURT
label: HH1

text: During the May 29, 2007, status conference in this action, the Court ordered that counsel
label: BODY

text: for certain parties form a committee to discuss eight designated case management issues and to
label: BODY

text: file a summary of accomplishments prior to the status conference set for August 20, 2007.
label: BODY

text: Minutes of Court (May 29, 2007).  The following summarizes the accomplishments of this group
label: BODY

text: and the status of their discussions and continuing efforts to address some of these issues.
label: BODY

text: The attorneys who participated in some or all of this effort are: Susan Schneider, United
label: BODY

text: Statesof America (“United States”); Wes Williams, Jr., Walker River Paiute Tribe (“Tribe”);
label: BODY

text: Simeon Herskovits, Mineral County/Walker Lake Working Group (“MC/WLWG”); John
label: BODY

text: Howard and William Schaeffer, D.Haight/the Landolts; Laura R. Schroeder, Reviglio; Karen
label: BODY

text: Peterson, U.S. Board of Water Commissioners (“U.S. Board”); Marta Adams, Nevada Dept. of
label: BODY

text: Wildlife (“Nevada”); Dale Ferguson, Walker River Irrigation District (“WRID”).  As stated
label: BODY

text: below, some of the attorneys have opted out of working on certain issues.
label: BODY

text: The group met by telephone on four occasions: June 14, 27; July 24; and August 9, 2007.
label: BODY

text: In addition, various participants conferred on other occasions.  The following summarizes efforts
label: BODY

text: and accomplishments according to each of the eight tasks assigned.
label: BODY

text: This report has been authorized by the members of the committee or their delegates to be
label: BODY

text: filed on behalf of the committee.  On August 9, 2007, Attorney Howard stated that he expects to
label: BODY

text: file his own report and agrees in part and disagrees in part with the committee report, but
label: BODY

text: declined to identify his specific concerns.  Attorney Schroeder may join in this separate report.
label: BODY

text: Attorneys Howard/Schaeffer and Schroeder have opted out of working on this issue.
label: BODY

text: This issue requires consideration of a number of applicable requirements, including:  In
label: BODY

text: re Authorization for Conversion to Case Management/Electronic Case Filing (CM/ECF),
label: BODY

text: Special Order 109Y (Sept. 29, 2005) (“Special Order 109Y”); U.S. Dist Ct., D. Nev., Electronic
label: BODY

text: Filing Procedures (rev. Aug. 24, 2006); and Fed. R. Civ. P. 5.  An approach to this issue also
label: BODY

text: requires consultation with the Court Clerk’s Office, which effort has begun, and requires
label: BODY

text: consideration of the use and application of PACER.
label: BODY

text: The parties have begun to discuss these requirements and various approaches to this issue
label: BODY

text: and will be prepared to discuss these issues in further detail and identify some approaches under
label: BODY

text: consideration with the Court during the upcoming status conference.
label: BODY

text: Attorneys Howard/Schaeffer and Schroeder have opted out of working on this issue.
label: BODY

text: Attorneys Schneider, Peterson and Adams have taken the lead on this issue with review and
label: BODY

text: additional work to be provided by Attorneys Ferguson and Herskowits.
label: BODY

text: The parties believe this issue focuses on the need to correct, update and coordinate with
label: BODY

text: the Court Clerk’s office regarding the Certificate of Service (“COS”) in this case.  The parties
label: BODY

text: wish to confirm their understanding of the scope of this issue with the Court on August 20, 2007.
label: BODY

text: Furthermore, the attorneys working on this issue believe that the COS in each of the three cases
label: BODY

text: require corrections and updating and have focused their efforts accordingly.  As a basic matter,
label: BODY

text: the Court and the parties will conserve resources if each COS is updated and all attorneys are
label: BODY

text: required to comply with the Court’s requirement that they register for e-file.
label: BODY

text: Attorneys Schneider and Peterson have each discussed this issue briefly with the Clerk’s
label: BODY

text: Office, and Attorney Peterson has arranged a meeting with Lia Griffin of the Clerk’s Office for
label: BODY

text: On July 9, 2007, Attorneys Adams, Peterson and Schneider reviewed the Court’s COS
label: BODY

text: and their own COS’s, identified names to be dropped, and divided inquiries to be made among
label: BODY

text: themselves.  We will be able to provide a preliminary list of proposed corrections and changes to
label: BODY

text: the Court on August 20, 2007, but are uncertain how the Court and/or Clerk’s Office wants this
label: BODY

text: information transmitted and if it requires additional filings (e.g., whether each attorney we
label: BODY

text: propose to delete from the COS must ask to be deleted).  We anticipate being able to provide
label: BODY

text: additional information after we meet with the Clerk’s Office on the morning of the scheduled
label: BODY

text: group of attorneys,” additional attorneys, and pro se parties who have filed notices of
label: BODY

text: appearance.  Parties who have been dismissed should be removed from the COS, if that has not

label: BODY

text: The Court directed the committee to consider if there is a way to use a standard set of
label: BODY

text: discovery to be served by the defendants on the plaintiffs and the plaintiffs on the defendants that
label: BODY

text: would encompass most of the issues identified.  The parties were to discuss procedures for such
label: BODY

text: discovery.  The Court recognized that implementation of discovery was “down the road.”  Tr. at
label: BODY

text: The parties agree that use of a standard set of interrogatories and document production
label: BODY

text: requests may be useful, but there is not yet universal agreement as to how it may be helpful in
label: BODY

text: this case.  The parties agree that the substantive content of any standard discovery cannot be
label: BODY

text: prepared until the identity of legal theories and threshold issues has occurred, if not later.
label: BODY

text: Consequently, assuming such an approach is appropriate for this case, they have agreed to hold
label: BODY

text: off preparing the substantive content of any such discovery.  In the meantime, the parties agree
label: BODY

text: that additional investigatory work can be done now to identify instances where such discovery
label: BODY

text: has been used and consider the procedural requirements for such an approach to discovery.  The
label: BODY

text: parties agreed to consult other attorneys about such an approach and to collect and share
label: BODY

text: information on specific approaches used in other cases  Their initial date to begin to share such
label: BODY

text: The Court directed the parties to consider the idea of a website and use of the Internet,
label: BODY

text: and noted that the parties would need to consider such issues as the purposes to be served, who
label: BODY

text: would implement and maintain a website, and who would be responsible for the costs of such an
label: BODY

text: The parties view the general concept of using a website favorably, but there is currently
label: BODY

text: no agreement on the use of a website and the purposes to be served by a website (e.g., pleadings
label: BODY

text: compilation, document repository, discovery production) and how that might relate to the other
label: BODY

text: case management issues under discussion.  Based on the review and scrutiny of preliminary
label: BODY

text: investigations into one possible service provider, the parties agree that they do not have
label: BODY

text: sufficient information on available technology and related costs for the various purposes for
label: BODY

text: which a website might be used.  Consequently, as an initial matter, the parties agree that these
label: BODY

text: issues require further investigation, which is ongoing.
label: BODY

text: Method for dealing with persons without access to website:
label: BODY

text: The parties have discussed this issue and determined that it should be deferred pending
label: BODY

text: further discussion and possible resolution of related case management issues (e.g., procedure for
label: BODY

text: service of pleadings; website proposal).  The resolution of some of these issues may address this
label: BODY

text: issue.  We also note Chief Judge Pro’s determination in Special Order 109Y that “the CM/ECF
label: BODY

text: System provides adequate procedures for the filing, review and retrieval of documents by parties
label: BODY

text: who are not able to access the Electronic Filing System from a remote location.”
label: BODY

text: Target date for completion of service:
label: BODY

text: The United States and Tribe have identified a “target date” for the completion of service
label: BODY

text: of the end of calendar year 2008.  On May 29, 2007, the United States noted before the Court
label: BODY

text: that this date is not “carved in stone” and does not include publication, challenges, etc. to the
label: BODY

text: MC/WLWG has identified a “target date” for the completion of service of the end of
label: BODY

text: calendar year 2008.  MC/WLWG also asserts that this date does not include publication,
label: BODY

text: challenges, etc., to the completion of service.
label: BODY

text: Set forth a schedule to identify legal issues and preliminary determination of legal
label: BODY

text: The Court directed the committee “to discuss and perhaps set forth a schedule, if you can
label: BODY

text: agree on it, for the identity of legal issues and preliminary determination of threshold issues. . . .
label: BODY

text: It makes some sense to me that the plaintiffs disclose their legal issues first and then the
label: BODY

text: defendants sometime after that.”  Tr. at 35.
label: BODY

text: The parties agree that this issue concerns just C-125-B and does not address C-125-C,
label: BODY

text: and is limited to Phase One of the C-125-B litigation, which addresses the claims of/on behalf of
label: BODY

text: the Walker River Paiute Tribe.  Further, the parties agree that the form of this identification may
label: BODY

text: be brief (e.g. John Howard: Just a “one-pager”).

text: Modification of service package of domestic users:
label: BODY

text: The parties have deferred to Attorneys Schneider and Ferguson to address this issue.
label: BODY

text: They will present suggested changes to the service package regarding domestic users and may
label: BODY

text: also suggest further changes to the package that may assist with other case management issues.
label: BODY

label: BODY
